Method Detail

getSinkIndex

public static <I,O> int getSinkIndex(Source<? extends I> source,
                                     Sink<? super O> sink)
                        throws SourceIsClosedException,
                               IllegalArgumentException
Returns the index for the given sink, i.e., its position in the internal data structure of the specified source.

Parameters:
source - The source the specified sink is subscribed to.
sink - The sink, whose index is to be determined.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.
IllegalArgumentException - If the specified sink is not subscribed to the given source.

getSourceIndex

public static <I,O> int getSourceIndex(Sink<? super O> sink,
                                       Source<? extends I> source)
                          throws SinkIsDoneException,
                                 IllegalArgumentException
Returns the index for the given source, i.e., its position in the internal data structure of the specified sink.

Parameters:
sink - The sink that is subscribed to the specified source.
source - The source, whose index is to be determined.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.
IllegalArgumentException - If the specified source is not registered by the given sink.

printPipeInformation

public static void printPipeInformation(Pipe<?,?> pipe)
                                 throws SourceIsClosedException,
                                        SinkIsDoneException
Prints subscription information for the specified pipe, i.e., the number of its sources and sinks, invokes System.out.println on the given pipe, its sources and sinks.

Parameters:
pipe - The pipe, whose subscription information shall be printed.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.

printSourceInformation

public static void printSourceInformation(Source<?> source)
                                   throws SourceIsClosedException
Prints subscription information for the specified source, i.e., the number of its sinks, invokes System.out.println on the given source and its sinks.

Parameters:
source - The source, whose subscription information shall be printed.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.

printSinkInformation

public static void printSinkInformation(Sink<?> sink)
                                 throws SinkIsDoneException
Prints subscription information for the specified sink, i.e., the number of its sources, invokes System.out.println on the given sink and its sources.

Parameters:
sink - The sink, whose subscription information shall be printed.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.

connect

public static <O> boolean connect(Source<? extends O> source,
                                  Sink<? super O> sink,
                                  int ID)
                       throws SourceIsClosedException,
                              SinkIsDoneException
Establishes a connection between the specified source and the sink using the ID for subscription.

Parameters:
source - The source the sink gets subscribed to.
sink - The sink to be subscribed.
ID - The ID which will be passed when transfering a new object to the specified sink.
Returns:
Returns true, if the connection has been established successfully, otherwise false.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.

disconnect

public static <O> boolean disconnect(Source<? extends O> source,
                                     Sink<? super O> sink,
                                     int ID)
                          throws SourceIsClosedException,
                                 SinkIsDoneException
Removes a connection between the specified source and the sink using the given ID.

Parameters:
source - The source the sink is subscribed to.
sink - The sink that is subscribed.
ID - The ID passed by transfering a new object to the specified sink.
Returns:
Returns true, if the connection has been removed successfully, otherwise false.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.

getCertainPredecessors

public static Source[] getCertainPredecessors(Sink<?> sink,
                                              Predicate<Source> returnPredicate,
                                              Predicate<Source> stopPredicate)
Traverses the graph in reverse direction starting at a given sink. The traversal will be stopped at those Sources that fulfill stopPredicate. All sources fulfilling returnPredicate that are visited during the traversal are returned.

Parameters:
sink - the sink to start from
returnPredicate - the Predicate the returned sources must fulfill
stopPredicate - the Predicate indicating where the traversal should stop
Returns:
all visited sources which fulfill returnPredicate

getCertainSuccessors

public static Sink[] getCertainSuccessors(Source<?> source,
                                          Predicate<Sink> returnPredicate,
                                          Predicate<Sink> stopPredicate)
Traverses the graph starting at a given Source. The traversal will be stopped at those Sinks that fulfill stopPredicate. All sources fulfilling returnPredicate that are visited during the traversal are returned.

Parameters:
source - the source to start from
returnPredicate - the Predicate the returned sinks must fulfill
stopPredicate - the Predicate indicatoing where the traversal should stop
Returns:
all visited sinks which fulfill returnPredicate

decorateWithRandomTimeFixedWindowsize

public static Source<TemporalObject<Integer>> decorateWithRandomTimeFixedWindowsize(Source<Integer> source,
                                                                                    HashMap<Integer,List<Long>> input,
                                                                                    Integer[] keys,
                                                                                    int startInc,
                                                                                    int intervalSize,
                                                                                    long seed)
In contrast to decorateWithRandomTimeIntervals, objects from this source will all have the same time interval size.

Parameters:
source -
input -
keys -
startInc -
intervalSize - interval length for objects
seed -
Returns:
Source whose objects all have the same time interval
